section.heading: Cy pres.
section.text: Except as otherwise provided in the terms of the trust, if a particular charitable purpose is or becomes unlawful, impracticable, impossible to achieve, or wasteful:

para.text: The trust does not fail, in whole or in part;
The trust property does not revert to the settlor or the settlor’s successors in interest; and

The court may apply cy pres to modify or terminate the trust by directing that the trust property be applied or distributed, in whole or in part, in a manner consistent with the settlor’s charitable purposes.

annotations.annotation: Uniform Law: This section is based upon § 413 of the Uniform Trust Code.
